Class CashRegister

  • java.lang.Object
    • CashRegister

  • public class CashRegister
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Sean Grimes, 09/19/17

    The CashRegister class implements a basic, cash only, cash register. The register assumes that all transactions will be completed using the follow denominations:
    Bills: Ones, Fives, Tens, Twenties, Fifties, Hundreds
    Coins: Pennies, Nickles, Dimes, Quarters
    Other denominations are not currently supported
    The CashRegister can accept and return floats for monetary values, however all internal representations are in pennies to avoid floating-point errors.

        Get the CashRegister value as a double -- represented how money is typically represented

      • purchaseItem

        public double purchaseItem​(double itemPrice,
                           long one,
                           long five,
                           long ten,
                           long twenty,
                           long fifty,
                           long hundred,
                           long penny,
                           long nickle,
                           long dime,
                           long quarter)
        Purchase an item using individual coins and bills. Exact change is NOT necessary.
        Parameters:
        itemPrice - price of the item, as a double (typical value, e.g. 11.99)
        one - number of ones
        five - number of fives
        ten - number of tens
        twenty - number of twenties
        fifty - number of fifties
        hundred - number of hundreds
        penny - number of pennies
        nickle - number of nickles
        dime - number of dimes
        quarter - number of quarters
        Returns:
        the customers change
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if customer didn't provide enough money to cover purchase price
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the CashRegister has insufficient money or types of money to provide change to the customer

      • purchaseItem

        public double purchaseItem​(double itemPrice,
                           BillPack bp,
                           CoinPack cp)
        Purchase an item using a BillPack and a CoinPack. Exact change is NOT necessary.
        Parameters:
        itemPrice - price of the item, as a double (typical value, e.g. 11.99)
        bp - BillPack for bills towards purchase
        cp - CoinPack for coins towards purchase
        Returns:
        the customers change as a double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if customer didn't provide enough money to cover purchase price
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the CashRegister has insufficient money or types of money to provide change to the customer

      • scanItem

        public double scanItem​(double itemPrice,
                       java.lang.String itemName)
        Used when scanning multiple items, this function will keep a running list of item prices and their names
        Parameters:
        itemPrice - the price of an item
        itemName - the name of an item
        Returns:
        the current total price, without tax

      • finalizePurchase

        public double finalizePurchase​(BillPack bp,
                               CoinPack cp)
        Used to finalize a purchase after scanning one or more items
        Parameters:
        bp - BillPack to cover purchase
        cp - CoinPack to cover purchase
        Returns:
        change to the user as a double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the purchase fails for any reason
